Cannoli French Toast

Jump to Recipe

Are you ready to elevate your breakfast game with a delicious twist on a classic dish? Cannoli French Toast combines the rich, creamy goodness of traditional Italian cannoli with the comforting, fluffy texture of French toast. This decadent recipe is perfect for special occasions or a delightful weekend brunch that will impress your family and friends. With just a few simple ingredients, including thick slices of brioche or challah bread, creamy ricotta cheese, and a touch of chocolate, you can create a mouthwatering dish that satisfies both sweet and savory cravings. Follow along as we guide you through each step, ensuring you master this irresistible Cannoli French Toast recipe that will have everyone asking for seconds!

Ingredients

bread (thick slices, like brioche or challah)

Choose day-old bread for better absorption of the egg mixture. If you can't find brioche or challah, you can use Texas toast or even a dense sourdough. For a gluten-free option, look for gluten-free bread that can hold up to soaking.

ricotta cheese

For a creamier texture, blend the ricotta before mixing it with powdered sugar. If you're looking for a lower-fat option, use part-skim ricotta. You can substitute with mascarpone for a richer flavor.

powdered sugar

Sift the powdered sugar if it's clumpy to ensure a smooth mixture with the ricotta. For a healthier option, you can use coconut sugar or a sugar substitute, but keep in mind the taste will differ slightly.

chocolate chips

Use mini chocolate chips for a more even distribution throughout the filling. If you prefer a different flavor, try using white chocolate chips or even chopped dark chocolate. For a dairy-free version, look for vegan chocolate chips.

eggs

For a fluffier French toast, use room temperature eggs. If you're looking for a vegan alternative, you can replace each egg with 1/4 cup of unsweetened applesauce or a flaxseed meal mixture (1 tablespoon flaxseed meal + 2.5 tablespoons water, let it sit until gel-like).

milk

Whole milk will give a richer flavor, but you can substitute with almond milk or oat milk for a dairy-free option. For added flavor, consider using flavored milk like vanilla or chocolate.

vanilla extract

Use pure vanilla extract for the best flavor. If you don't have vanilla extract, you can substitute with almond extract or even a splash of rum for a different twist.

cinnamon

Make sure your cinnamon is fresh for the best flavor. You can also add a pinch of nutmeg or cardamom for extra warmth and spice.

butter

For a richer flavor, use unsalted butter and add a pinch of salt to the egg mixture. You can also substitute with coconut oil or a non-stick spray if you're looking for a dairy-free option.

optional toppings (like whipped cream or extra chocolate chips)

For a fun twist, consider adding fresh berries or sliced bananas as toppings. You can also dust the finished French toast with more powdered sugar for a beautiful presentation.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Ricotta Filling

    In a mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of ricotta cheese, 1/4 cup of powdered sugar, and 1/4 cup of chocolate chips. Mix thoroughly using a spatula or whisk until the ingredients are well blended and smooth. This will serve as the sweet filling for your Cannoli French Toast.

  • Step 2: Make the Egg Mixture

    In a separate bowl, whisk together 2 eggs, 1/2 cup of milk, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon. Ensure that the eggs are fully beaten and the mixture is homogeneous. This will be the custard that flavors and coats the bread.

  • Step 3: Prep the Bread

    Take 4 thick slices of bread, preferably brioche or challah, and dip each slice into the egg mixture. Make sure both sides are fully coated, allowing excess to drip off. This step is crucial for achieving a rich, custardy texture.

  • Step 4: Assemble the Sandwiches

    Spread a generous amount of the ricotta filling on one side of a dipped slice of bread. Place another dipped slice on top, forming a sandwich. Repeat this process for all slices. Press down gently to help the filling adhere.

  • Step 5: Cook the Sandwiches

    In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Once the butter is bubbling, carefully add the sandwiches to the skillet. Cook for 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown and crisp. Make sure to keep an eye on the heat to prevent burning.

  • Step 6: Serve and Enjoy

    Once cooked, transfer the Cannoli French Toast sandwiches to a serving plate. Serve warm, optionally topped with whipped cream, extra chocolate chips, or a dusting of powdered sugar for added sweetness.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare the bread for French toast?

For the best French toast, use thick slices of bread like brioche or challah. If possible, let the bread sit out for a few hours to become slightly stale, which helps it absorb the egg mixture without becoming soggy.

What is the best way to mix the ricotta filling?

In a bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, powdered sugar, and chocolate chips. Use a fork or a whisk to mix until smooth and well-blended. Make sure there are no lumps for a creamy filling.

How do I safely whisk eggs without making a mess?

Crack the eggs into a bowl first, then use a fork or a whisk to beat them. To avoid splatters, whisk gently at first, then increase speed as the eggs combine. You can also cover the bowl lightly with your other hand to contain any potential mess.

How can I ensure my French toast is cooked evenly?

Cook the French toast over medium heat, allowing it to brown nicely without burning. If you're making multiple sandwiches, consider keeping the finished ones warm in an oven set to low (around 200°F or 93°C) while you finish cooking the rest.

What should I do if my French toast is sticking to the skillet?

Make sure your skillet is adequately preheated and you use enough butter. If you find it sticking, gently use a spatula to loosen the edges before flipping. Non-stick pans can also help reduce sticking.

Can I prepare any components of the Cannoli French Toast in advance?

Yes! You can mix the ricotta filling ahead of time and store it in the refrigerator. Just assemble the sandwiches and cook them when you’re ready to serve.

What are some good toppings for Cannoli French Toast?

Some great toppings include whipped cream, extra chocolate chips, or even a drizzle of chocolate syrup. Fresh berries or a sprinkle of additional powdered sugar can also add a nice touch.

How do I know when the French toast is done cooking?

The French toast is done when both sides are golden brown and the center feels firm to the touch. You can also cut one sandwich in half to check if the egg mixture is fully cooked.

What can I do if I don’t have chocolate chips?

If you don’t have chocolate chips, you can substitute with finely chopped nuts, dried fruit, or leave them out altogether for a classic ricotta flavor.

How do I clean up efficiently after cooking?

To make cleanup easier, fill your sink with warm soapy water before you start cooking. As you finish with each tool or bowl, rinse them off and place them in the soapy water. This way, you'll have less to scrub after cooking!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

To make this dish gluten-free, substitute the bread with a gluten-free bread option. For dairy-free alternatives, use a plant-based ricotta and non-dairy milk. If you want to reduce sugar, consider using a sugar substitute in the ricotta mixture or skipping the powdered sugar altogether. This dish can be made vegetarian by ensuring the bread used is free from animal fats.

Pairings

For a delightful brunch experience, pair Cannoli French Toast with crispy bacon or sausage links for a savory contrast. A side of fresh fruit, such as berries or sliced bananas, adds a refreshing touch. For beverages, consider serving a rich, dark roast coffee or a creamy vanilla latte to complement the flavors. A sweet dessert wine like Vin Santo or a sparkling wine can also elevate the meal for special occasions.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Cannoli French Toast warm on a large plate, dusted with additional powdered sugar for a beautiful presentation. Drizzle with chocolate sauce or a homemade vanilla syrup for added sweetness. Garnish with fresh mint leaves or a sprinkle of cocoa powder for color. If serving for a crowd, consider presenting it on a tiered serving stand, allowing guests to choose their toppings, such as whipped cream, chocolate chips, or a dollop of mascarpone.

Cannoli French Toast

25 min
$8
550 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 2

Allergens:

DairyEggsGluten

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

ItalianAmerican

Course:

BreakfastBrunch

Tags:

BreakfastDessertSweet

Description

A delightful twist on classic French toast, filled with sweet ricotta and chocolate, reminiscent of cannoli!

Ingredients

  • bread (thick slices, like brioche or challah): 4 slices
  • ricotta cheese: 1 cup
  • powdered sugar: 1/4 cup
  • chocolate chips: 1/4 cup
  • eggs: 2
  • milk: 1/2 cup
  • vanilla extract: 1 teaspoon
  • cinnamon: 1/2 teaspoon
  • butter: 2 tablespoons
  • optional toppings (like whipped cream or extra chocolate chips): to taste

Date Created:

11/17/2024
